title: geth returns Forkchoice requested unknown head warning after using txlookuplimit=0 command and stops synchronizing blocks
body:
**Problem:** 
When using etl to export the first 1,000,000 blocks, it was executed normally, but an exception occurred when exporting the receipt.
https://github.com/blockchain-etl/ethereum-etl/issues/252
According to the method of the website, after adding `txlookuplimit=0â€™`after geth, geth issued a warning '`Forkchoice requested unknown head`' and did not update the block. After deleting all the data of geth, the same problem remained.



```
WARN [02-09|09:03:37.269] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=c4bbd7..e5c7f1
WARN [02-09|09:03:45.751] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=174209..d5e166
INFO [02-09|09:03:53.651] Writing clean trie cache to disk         path=/media/kevinj/2T/ethdata/getedata/geth/triecache threads=1
INFO [02-09|09:03:53.651] Regenerated local transaction journal    transactions=0 accounts=0
INFO [02-09|09:03:53.661] Persisted the clean trie cache           path=/media/kevinj/2T/ethdata/getedata/geth/triecache elapsed=10.750ms
WARN [02-09|09:03:54.921] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=65f2a9..35bfd8
INFO [02-09|09:04:00.480] New local node record                    seq=1,675,839,833,274 id=3134f68db6e3dde5 ip=218.235.241.119 udp=30303 tcp=30303
WARN [02-09|09:04:02.914] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=31a306..900394

WARN [02-09|09:05:11.688] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=a7aff1..e31ed1
WARN [02-09|09:05:19.766] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=348b05..23f9c8
WARN [02-09|09:05:22.508] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=a0c581..dce964
WARN [02-09|09:05:55.872] Beacon client online, but no consensus updates received in a while. Please fix your beacon client to follow the chain! 
WARN [02-09|09:07:26.453] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=ca5171..2e281f
WARN [02-09|09:07:35.520] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=a5fc79..f99b15

WARN [02-09|09:07:52.338] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=72b988..c72fe8
WARN [02-09|09:08:00.382] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=62736e..eada1e
WARN [02-09|09:08:08.698] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=5e626e..ec8a2d
WARN [02-09|09:08:16.437] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=a0e1a7..c9844e
WARN [02-09|09:08:25.270] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=a882d5..28b704
WARN [02-09|09:08:33.170] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=74fc06..5b0c26
WARN [02-09|09:08:41.462] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=f866f9..2693e8
WARN [02-09|09:08:50.228] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=afab08..4c9f55
WARN [02-09|09:08:59.413] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=a4bab4..c59073
WARN [02-09|09:09:07.417] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=5bb0ef..b52a31
WARN [02-09|09:09:15.816] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=6cc703..bb2e5e
WARN [02-09|09:09:23.921] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=5a0405..f92866
WARN [02-09|09:09:33.672] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=fa4ac6..be28c8
WARN [02-09|09:09:41.996] Forkchoice requested unknown head        hash=6ba11d..756a03
```

**System information**
- Geth version: 1.10.26-stable
- CL client & version: lighthouse
- OS & Version: Linux 18.04

**Expected behaviour**
sync block

**Actual behavior**
Forkchoice requested unknown head

**Steps to reproduce the behavior**
`geth --authrpc.addr localhost --authrpc.port 8551 --authrpc.vhosts localhost --authrpc.jwtsecret /tmp/jwtsecret --datadir="/media/kevinj/2T/ethdata/getedata" --txlookuplimit=0`

```
lighthouse \
          beacon_node \
          --network mainnet \
          --debug-level info \
          --datadir /media/kevinj/2T/ethdata/CLdata \
          --eth1 \
          --http \
          --http-allow-sync-stalled \
          --metrics \
          --execution-endpoints http://127.0.0.1:8551 \
          --enr-udp-port=9000 \
          --enr-tcp-port=9000 \
          --discovery-port=9000 \
          --suggested-fee-recipient=0xadc781673c45f7fce3ba1938e6ee0b4aebb9ba75 \
          --jwt-secrets="/tmp/jwtsecret"
```

Just ran into again this today, second time in two months, first time I started a new sync. But this time, after waiting 30 minutes, it started syncing again. 


@kwg126 There's no link between the txlookup limit and the forkchoice updater. Seems your beacon client is not giving us new payloads, only trying to set the heads (which is not enough). Perhaps it would be good to check the logs from lighthouse too, it might help point out what's wrong.
@amaurer your issue does not seem related to this ticket
